channel.title: Conformation on RD's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Conformation on RD's Blog

item.title: Multiple Diverse Ligands Binding at a Single Protein Site: A Matter of Pre-existing Populations
item.description: Notes on 2002 Protein Science review on how proteins with specificity bind multiple diverse ligands through pre-existing conformational populations and hinge-bending motions.

item.title: Multiple Diverse Ligands Binding at a Single Protein Site: A Matter of Pre-existing Populations
item.description: Notes on 2002 Protein Science review on how proteins with specificity bind multiple diverse ligands through pre-existing conformational populations and hinge-bending motions.

item.title: Water-Membrane Partition Thermodynamics of an Amphiphilic Lipopeptide: An Enthalpy-Driven Hydrophobic Effect
item.description: Notes on 2008 Biophysical Journal paper analyzing the thermodynamics of membrane insertion for an H-ras lipopeptide anchor (ANCH), highlighting the role of enthalpy-driven hydrophobic effects and conformational selection.

item.title: Water-Membrane Partition Thermodynamics of an Amphiphilic Lipopeptide: An Enthalpy-Driven Hydrophobic Effect
item.description: Notes on 2008 Biophysical Journal paper analyzing the thermodynamics of membrane insertion for an H-ras lipopeptide anchor (ANCH), highlighting the role of enthalpy-driven hydrophobic effects and conformational selection.

item.title: Diversity of Conformational States and Changes within the EF-hand Protein Superfamily
item.description: Notes on a 1999 Proteins review analyzing the conformational diversity of EF-hand motifs in calcium-binding proteins. Introduces Vector Geometry Mapping (VGM) to dissect helix movements beyond simple interhelical angles, and discusses functional implications of EF-hand plasticity.

item.title: Diversity of Conformational States and Changes within the EF-hand Protein Superfamily
item.description: Notes on a 1999 Proteins review analyzing the conformational diversity of EF-hand motifs in calcium-binding proteins. Introduces Vector Geometry Mapping (VGM) to dissect helix movements beyond simple interhelical angles, and discusses functional implications of EF-hand plasticity.

item.title: Structural Basis for Diversity of the EF-hand Calcium-binding Proteins
item.description: Notes on 2006 JMB review detailing EF-hand protein diversity, mechanisms of Ca2+ binding, and conformational change. Highlights the EFbeta-scaffold model and structural determinants of domain opening in calcium-binding proteins.

item.title: Structural Basis for Diversity of the EF-hand Calcium-binding Proteins
item.description: Notes on 2006 JMB review detailing EF-hand protein diversity, mechanisms of Ca2+ binding, and conformational change. Highlights the EFbeta-scaffold model and structural determinants of domain opening in calcium-binding proteins.

item.title: Structures and Metal-ion Binding Properties of the Ca2+-Binding Helix–Loop–Helix EF-hand Motifs
item.description: Notes on 2007 Biochemical Journal review discussing EF-hand structural diversity, Ca²⁺/Mg²⁺ binding properties, cooperativity, and conformational changes. Focus on EF-hand pairing, metal selectivity, and functional adaptation for signaling.

item.title: Structures and Metal-ion Binding Properties of the Ca2+-Binding Helix–Loop–Helix EF-hand Motifs
item.description: Notes on 2007 Biochemical Journal review discussing EF-hand structural diversity, Ca²⁺/Mg²⁺ binding properties, cooperativity, and conformational changes. Focus on EF-hand pairing, metal selectivity, and functional adaptation for signaling.

item.title: Pinning Down Proline-Directed Phosphorylation Signaling
item.description: Notes on a 2002 Trends in Cell Biology review introducing phosphorylation-specific prolyl isomerization as a novel signaling mechanism. Pin1-mediated cis-trans switching of pSer/Thr-Pro motifs acts as a conformational timer for cellular signaling, impacting activity, interactions, and localization of key regulatory proteins.

item.title: Pinning Down Proline-Directed Phosphorylation Signaling
item.description: Notes on a 2002 Trends in Cell Biology review introducing phosphorylation-specific prolyl isomerization as a novel signaling mechanism. Pin1-mediated cis-trans switching of pSer/Thr-Pro motifs acts as a conformational timer for cellular signaling, impacting activity, interactions, and localization of key regulatory proteins.

item.title: Sequence Determinants of the Conformational Properties of an Intrinsically Disordered Protein Prior to and Upon Multisite Phosphorylation
item.description: A groundbreaking exploration of how sequence patterning, especially proline and charge distributions, governs the conformational behavior of intrinsically disordered regions (IDRs) even under multisite phosphorylation, with compensatory conformational changes maintaining overall dimensions.

item.title: Sequence Determinants of the Conformational Properties of an Intrinsically Disordered Protein Prior to and Upon Multisite Phosphorylation
item.description: A groundbreaking exploration of how sequence patterning, especially proline and charge distributions, governs the conformational behavior of intrinsically disordered regions (IDRs) even under multisite phosphorylation, with compensatory conformational changes maintaining overall dimensions.

item.title: Transient Non-native Hydrogen Bonds Promote Activation of a Signaling Protein
item.description: A groundbreaking study connecting protein folding energy landscapes to functional conformational changes in signaling proteins, showing how transient, non-native hydrogen bonds lower transition barriers and facilitate activation without unfolding.

item.title: Transient Non-native Hydrogen Bonds Promote Activation of a Signaling Protein
item.description: A groundbreaking study connecting protein folding energy landscapes to functional conformational changes in signaling proteins, showing how transient, non-native hydrogen bonds lower transition barriers and facilitate activation without unfolding.

item.title: Surface Comparison Reveals Conserved Activation Mechanism in Protein Kinases
item.description: Notes on 2006_PNAS paper exploring conserved structural mechanisms of kinase activation via surface comparison.

item.title: Community Analysis of PKA: A Dynamic View of Kinase Architecture
item.description: Notes on a 2014 PNAS paper analyzing PKA dynamics through community analysis.

item.title: The Conformational Plasticity of Protein Kinases
item.description: Notes on 2002 Cell review discussing conformational plasticity of protein kinases, highlighting key structural elements, activation mechanisms, and pseudosubstrate regulation. Includes insights on αC helix, activation loop, and therapeutic implications (e.g., Gleevec binding).

item.title: The Conformational Plasticity of Protein Kinases
item.description: Notes on 2002 Cell review discussing conformational plasticity of protein kinases, highlighting key structural elements, activation mechanisms, and pseudosubstrate regulation. Includes insights on αC helix, activation loop, and therapeutic implications (e.g., Gleevec binding).

item.title: Intrinsically Disordered Regions Are Poised to Act as Sensors of Cellular Chemistry
item.description: Notes on the 2023 TIBS review proposing that intrinsically disordered regions (IDRs), with their sequence-dependent structural biases, are well-suited to act as sensors and actuators of cellular physicochemistry. Discusses physical principles, molecular mechanisms, and experimental strategies for investigating IDR sensitivity and highlights their potential biological roles.

item.title: Intrinsically Disordered Regions Are Poised to Act as Sensors of Cellular Chemistry
item.description: Notes on the 2023 TIBS review proposing that intrinsically disordered regions (IDRs), with their sequence-dependent structural biases, are well-suited to act as sensors and actuators of cellular physicochemistry. Discusses physical principles, molecular mechanisms, and experimental strategies for investigating IDR sensitivity and highlights their potential biological roles.

item.title: Single-Molecule Spectroscopy Reveals Polymer Effects of Disordered Proteins in Crowded Environments
item.description: Notes on the 2014 PNAS paper using single-molecule FRET to analyze the conformational response of intrinsically disordered proteins (IDPs) to molecular crowding. Highlights how IDP compaction depends not only on crowder concentration but also on crowder size, challenging traditional crowding models and introducing polymer-specific effects.

item.title: Single-Molecule Spectroscopy Reveals Polymer Effects of Disordered Proteins in Crowded Environments
item.description: Notes on the 2014 PNAS paper using single-molecule FRET to analyze the conformational response of intrinsically disordered proteins (IDPs) to molecular crowding. Highlights how IDP compaction depends not only on crowder concentration but also on crowder size, challenging traditional crowding models and introducing polymer-specific effects.

item.title: Revealing the Hidden Sensitivity of Intrinsically Disordered Proteins to Their Chemical Environments
item.description: Notes on the 2020 ACS paper introducing a combined experimental, computational, and analytical framework to study how IDRs respond to changes in chemical environments. The work reveals sequence-dependent compaction and expansion of IDRs under different solutes and highlights the role of chemical sensitivity as an added layer of regulation in biology.

item.title: Revealing the Hidden Sensitivity of Intrinsically Disordered Proteins to Their Chemical Environments
item.description: Notes on the 2020 ACS paper introducing a combined experimental, computational, and analytical framework to study how IDRs respond to changes in chemical environments. The work reveals sequence-dependent compaction and expansion of IDRs under different solutes and highlights the role of chemical sensitivity as an added layer of regulation in biology.

item.title: The CaMKII Holoenzyme Structure in Activation-Competent Conformation
item.description: Notes on a 2017 Nature Communications paper revealing the 3D structure of the CaMKII holoenzyme in an activation-competent conformation, emphasizing the role of flexible linkers and dimeric kinase domain interactions in regulating activation and frequency decoding.

item.title: The CaMKII Holoenzyme Structure in Activation-Competent Conformation
item.description: Notes on a 2017 Nature Communications paper revealing the 3D structure of the CaMKII holoenzyme in an activation-competent conformation, emphasizing the role of flexible linkers and dimeric kinase domain interactions in regulating activation and frequency decoding.

item.title: Target-Induced Conformational Adaptation of Calmodulin in Complex with Nematode CaMKK Peptide: Insights into Calcium-Dependent Kinase Regulation
item.description: Notes on a 2001 Journal of Molecular Biology paper revealing the crystal structure of Ca2+/CaM bound to a CaMKK-derived peptide, highlighting how calmodulin achieves conformational flexibility to accommodate diverse targets — offering a mechanistic basis for how CaM relieves autoinhibition of kinases like CaMKK and mediates calcium signal transduction.

item.title: Target-Induced Conformational Adaptation of Calmodulin in Complex with Nematode CaMKK Peptide: Insights into Calcium-Dependent Kinase Regulation
item.description: Notes on a 2001 Journal of Molecular Biology paper revealing the crystal structure of Ca2+/CaM bound to a CaMKK-derived peptide, highlighting how calmodulin achieves conformational flexibility to accommodate diverse targets — offering a mechanistic basis for how CaM relieves autoinhibition of kinases like CaMKK and mediates calcium signal transduction.

item.title: Common Activation Mechanism in CDPK: Structural Insights into CAD Refolding
item.description: Note on the detailed structural study of CDPK activation, focusing on apicomplexan CAD conformations (CpCDPK, PfCDPK3), offering new insight into a potentially universal activation mechanism for CDPKs.

item.title: Common Activation Mechanism in CDPK: Structural Insights into CAD Refolding
item.description: Note on the detailed structural study of CDPK activation, focusing on apicomplexan CAD conformations (CpCDPK, PfCDPK3), offering new insight into a potentially universal activation mechanism for CDPKs.

item.title: Real-Time Imaging of CDPK Conformational Changes Reveals Calcium-Decoding Mechanisms in Planta
item.description: Notes on a 2023 The Plant Cell study that introduces a genetically encoded FRET-based biosensor to monitor real-time conformational changes of CDPKs (CPKs) in response to calcium signals in vivo, highlighting distinct calcium sensitivities of CPK21 and CPK23 in stress responses.

item.title: Real-Time Imaging of CDPK Conformational Changes Reveals Calcium-Decoding Mechanisms in Planta
item.description: Notes on a 2023 The Plant Cell study that introduces a genetically encoded FRET-based biosensor to monitor real-time conformational changes of CDPKs (CPKs) in response to calcium signals in vivo, highlighting distinct calcium sensitivities of CPK21 and CPK23 in stress responses.

item.title: Evidence for Differing Roles for Each Lobe of the Calmodulin-like Domain in a Calcium-dependent Protein Kinase
item.description: Notes on a 2004 JBC paper exploring differential roles of N- and C-lobes in the CaM-like domain (CaM-LD) of CDPK, uncovering distinct Ca2+ affinities and their role in regulating kinase activation through interactions with the junction domain.

item.title: Evidence for Differing Roles for Each Lobe of the Calmodulin-like Domain in a Calcium-dependent Protein Kinase
item.description: Notes on a 2004 JBC paper exploring differential roles of N- and C-lobes in the CaM-like domain (CaM-LD) of CDPK, uncovering distinct Ca2+ affinities and their role in regulating kinase activation through interactions with the junction domain.
